description: Returns information about a training job. Some of the attributes below only appear if the training job successfully starts. If the training job fails, TrainingJobStatus is Failed and, depending on the FailureReason, attributes like TrainingStartTime, TrainingTimeInSeconds, TrainingEndTime, and BillableTimeInSeconds may not be present in the response.

parameters.name: TrainingJobName
parameters.description: The name of the training job.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobName
nested_items.description: Name of the model training job.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the training job.

nested_items.name: TuningJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the associated hyperparameter tuning job if the training job was launched by a hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: LabelingJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SageMaker Ground Truth labeling job that created the transform or training job.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AutoML job.

nested_items.name: ModelArtifacts
nested_items.description: Information about the Amazon S3 location that is configured for storing model artifacts.

nested_items.name: S3ModelArtifacts
nested_items.description: The path of the S3 object that contains the model artifacts. For example, s3://bucket-name/keynameprefix/model.tar.gz.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the training job.
InProgress - The training is in progress.
Completed - The training job has completed.
Failed - The training job has failed. To see the reason for the failure, see the FailureReason field in the response to a DescribeTrainingJobResponse call.
Stopping - The training job is stopping.
Stopped - The training job has stopped.

nested_items.name: SecondaryStatus
nested_items.description: Provides detailed information about the state of the training job. For detailed information on the secondary status of the training job, see StatusMessage under SecondaryStatusTransition.
Starting - Starting the training job.
Downloading - An optional stage for algorithms that support File training input mode. It indicates that data is being downloaded to the ML storage volumes.
Training - Training is in progress.
Interrupted - The job stopped because the managed spot training instances were interrupted.
Uploading - Training is complete and the model artifacts are being uploaded to the S3 location.
Completed - The training job has completed.
Failed - The training job has failed. The reason for the failure is returned in the FailureReason field of DescribeTrainingJobResponse.
MaxRuntimeExceeded - The job stopped because it exceeded the maximum allowed runtime.
MaxWaitTimeExceeded - The job stopped because it exceeded the maximum allowed wait time.
Stopped - The training job has stopped.
Stopping - Stopping the training job.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: If the training job failed, the reason it failed.

nested_items.name: HyperParameters
nested_items.description: Algorithm-specific parameters.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AlgorithmSpecification
nested_items.description: Information about the algorithm used for training, and algorithm metadata.

nested_items.name: TrainingImage
nested_items.description: The registry path of the Docker image that contains the training algorithm. For information about docker registry paths for SageMaker built-in algorithms, see Docker Registry Paths and Example Code in the Amazon SageMaker developer guide. SageMaker supports both registry/repository[:tag] and registry/repository[@digest] image path formats. For more information about using your custom training container, see Using Your Own Algorithms with Amazon SageMaker.

nested_items.name: AlgorithmName
nested_items.description: The name of the algorithm resource to use for the training job. This must be an algorithm resource that you created or subscribe to on Amazon Web Services Marketplace.

nested_items.name: TrainingInputMode
nested_items.description: The training input mode that the algorithm supports. For more information about input modes, see Algorithms.

nested_items.name: MetricDefinitions
nested_items.description: A list of metric definition objects. Each object specifies the metric name and regular expressions used to parse algorithm logs. SageMaker publishes each metric to Amazon CloudWatch.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the metric.

nested_items.name: Regex
nested_items.description: A regular expression that searches the output of a training job and gets the value of the metric. For more information about using regular expressions to define metrics, see Defining metrics and environment variables.

nested_items.name: EnableSageMakerMetricsTimeSeries
nested_items.description: To generate and save time-series metrics during training, set to true. The default is false and time-series metrics aren't generated except in the following cases:
You use one of the SageMaker built-in algorithms.
You use one of the following Prebuilt SageMaker Docker Images:
You specify at least one MetricDefinition.

nested_items.name: ContainerEntrypoint
nested_items.description: The entrypoint script for a Docker container used to run a training job. This script takes precedence over the default train processing instructions. See How Amazon SageMaker Runs Your Training Image for more information.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ContainerArguments
nested_items.description: The arguments for a container used to run a training job. See How Amazon SageMaker Runs Your Training Image for additional information.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TrainingImageConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration to use an image from a private Docker registry for a training job.

nested_items.name: TrainingRepositoryAccessMode
nested_items.description: The method that your training job will use to gain access to the images in your private Docker registry. For access to an image in a private Docker registry, set to Vpc.

nested_items.name: TrainingRepositoryAuthConfig
nested_items.description: An object containing authentication information for a private Docker registry containing your training images.

nested_items.name: TrainingRepositoryCredentialsProviderArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services Lambda function used to give SageMaker access credentials to your private Docker registry.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) role configured for the training job.

nested_items.name: InputDataConfig
nested_items.description: An array of Channel objects that describes each data input channel.

nested_items.name: ChannelName
nested_items.description: The name of the channel.

nested_items.name: DataSource
nested_items.description: The location of the channel data.

nested_items.name: S3DataSource
nested_items.description: The S3 location of the data source that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: If you choose S3Prefix, S3Uri identifies a key name prefix. SageMaker uses all objects that match the specified key name prefix for model training.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest. For example:
A key name prefix might look like this: s3://bucketname/exampleprefix/

A manifest might look like this: s3://bucketname/example.manifest A manifest is an S3 object which is a JSON file consisting of an array of elements. The first element is a prefix which is followed by one or more suffixes. SageMaker appends the suffix elements to the prefix to get a full set of S3Uri. Note that the prefix must be a valid non-empty S3Uri that precludes users from specifying a manifest whose individual S3Uri is sourced from different S3 buckets. The following code example shows a valid manifest format: [ {"prefix": "s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/"}, "relative/path/to/custdata-1", "relative/path/custdata-2", ... "relative/path/custdata-N" ] This JSON is equivalent to the following S3Uri list: s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/to/custdata-1 s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-2 ... s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-N The complete set of S3Uri in this manifest is the input data for the channel for this data source. The object that each S3Uri points to must be readable by the IAM role that SageMaker uses to perform tasks on your behalf.

nested_items.name: S3DataDistributionType
nested_items.description: If you want SageMaker to replicate the entire dataset on each ML compute instance that is launched for model training, specify FullyReplicated.

nested_items.name: AttributeNames
nested_items.description: A list of one or more attribute names to use that are found in a specified augmented manifest file.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupNames
nested_items.description: A list of names of instance groups that get data from the S3 data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ModelAccessConfig
nested_items.description: The access configuration file to control access to the ML model. You can explicitly accept the model end-user license agreement (EULA) within the ModelAccessConfig.
If you are a Jumpstart user, see the End-user license agreements section for more details on accepting the EULA.

If you are an AutoML user, see the Optional Parameters section of Create an AutoML job to fine-tune text generation models using the API for details on How to set the EULA acceptance when fine-tuning a model using the AutoML API.

nested_items.name: HubAccessConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for a private hub model reference that points to a SageMaker JumpStart public hub model.

nested_items.name: HubContentArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of your private model hub content. This should be a ModelReference resource type that points to a SageMaker JumpStart public hub model.

nested_items.name: FileSystemDataSource
nested_items.description: The file system that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The file system id.

nested_items.name: FileSystemAccessMode
nested_items.description: The access mode of the mount of the directory associated with the channel. A directory can be mounted either in ro (read-only) or rw (read-write) mode.

nested_items.name: FileSystemType
nested_items.description: The file system type.

nested_items.name: DirectoryPath
nested_items.description: The full path to the directory to associate with the channel.

nested_items.name: ContentType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the data.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: If training data is compressed, the compression type. The default value is None. CompressionType is used only in Pipe input mode. In File mode, leave this field unset or set it to None.

nested_items.name: RecordWrapperType
nested_items.description: Specify RecordIO as the value when input data is in raw format but the training algorithm requires the RecordIO format. In this case, SageMaker wraps each individual S3 object in a RecordIO record. If the input data is already in RecordIO format, you don't need to set this attribute. For more information, see Create a Dataset Using RecordIO.

nested_items.name: InputMode
nested_items.description: (Optional) The input mode to use for the data channel in a training job. If you don't set a value for InputMode, SageMaker uses the value set for TrainingInputMode. Use this parameter to override the TrainingInputMode setting in a AlgorithmSpecification request when you have a channel that needs a different input mode from the training job's general setting. To download the data from Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to the provisioned ML storage volume, and mount the directory to a Docker volume, use File input mode. To stream data directly from Amazon S3 to the container, choose Pipe input mode.

nested_items.name: ShuffleConfig
nested_items.description: A configuration for a shuffle option for input data in a channel. If you use S3Prefix for S3DataType, this shuffles the results of the S3 key prefix matches. If you use ManifestFile, the order of the S3 object references in the ManifestFile is shuffled. If you use AugmentedManifestFile, the order of the JSON lines in the AugmentedManifestFile is shuffled. The shuffling order is determined using the Seed value.

nested_items.name: Seed
nested_items.description: Determines the shuffling order in ShuffleConfig value.

nested_items.name: OutputDataConfig
nested_items.description: The S3 path where model artifacts that you configured when creating the job are stored. SageMaker creates subfolders for model artifacts.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. The KmsKeyId can be any of the following formats:
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// KMS Key Alias "alias/ExampleAlias"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key Alias "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want SageMaker to store the model artifacts. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: The model output compression type. Select None to output an uncompressed model, recommended for large model outputs. Defaults to gzip.

nested_items.name: ResourceConfig
nested_items.description: Resources, including ML compute instances and ML storage volumes, that are configured for model training.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The ML compute instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of ML compute instances to use. For distributed training, provide a value greater than 1.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size of the ML storage volume that you want to provision.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key that SageMaker uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the training job.
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

nested_items.name: KeepAlivePeriodInSeconds
nested_items.description: The duration of time in seconds to retain configured resources in a warm pool for subsequent training jobs.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroups
nested_items.description: The configuration of a heterogeneous cluster in JSON format.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: Specifies the instance type of the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of instances of the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the instance group.

nested_items.name: TrainingPlanArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN); of the training plan to use for this resource configuration.

nested_items.name: WarmPoolStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the warm pool associated with the training job.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the warm pool.
InUse: The warm pool is in use for the training job.
Available: The warm pool is available to reuse for a matching training job.
Reused: The warm pool moved to a matching training job for reuse.

Terminated: The warm pool is no longer available. Warm pools are unavailable if they are terminated by a user, terminated for a patch update, or terminated for exceeding the specified KeepAlivePeriodInSeconds.

nested_items.name: ResourceRetainedBillableTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The billable time in seconds used by the warm pool. Billable time refers to the absolute wall-clock time.

nested_items.name: ReusedByJob
nested_items.description: The name of the matching training job that reused the warm pool.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: A VpcConfig object that specifies the VPC that this training job has access to. For more information, see Protect Training Jobs by Using an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The VPC security group IDs, in the form sg-xxxxxxxx. Specify the security groups for the VPC that is specified in the Subnets field.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnets in the VPC to which you want to connect your training job or model. For information about the availability of specific instance types, see Supported Instance Types and Availability Zones.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StoppingCondition
nested_items.description: Specifies a limit to how long a model training job can run. It also specifies how long a managed Spot training job has to complete. When the job reaches the time limit, SageMaker ends the training job. Use this API to cap model training costs.

nested_items.name: MaxRuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a training or compilation job can run before it is stopped.

nested_items.name: MaxWaitTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a managed Spot training job has to complete. It is the amount of time spent waiting for Spot capacity plus the amount of time the job can run. It must be equal to or greater than MaxRuntimeInSeconds. If the job does not complete during this time, SageMaker ends the job.

nested_items.name: MaxPendingTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a training or compilation job can be pending before it is stopped.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the training job was created.

nested_items.name: TrainingStartTime
nested_items.description: Indicates the time when the training job starts on training instances. You are billed for the time interval between this time and the value of TrainingEndTime. The start time in CloudWatch Logs might be later than this time. The difference is due to the time it takes to download the training data and to the size of the training container.

nested_items.name: TrainingEndTime
nested_items.description: Indicates the time when the training job ends on training instances. You are billed for the time interval between the value of TrainingStartTime and this time. For successful jobs and stopped jobs, this is the time after model artifacts are uploaded. For failed jobs, this is the time when SageMaker detects a job failure.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the status of the training job was last modified.

nested_items.name: SecondaryStatusTransitions
nested_items.description: A history of all of the secondary statuses that the training job has transitioned through.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Contains a secondary status information from a training job.
Starting - Starting the training job.
Downloading - An optional stage for algorithms that support File training input mode. It indicates that data is being downloaded to the ML storage volumes.
Training - Training is in progress.
Uploading - Training is complete and the model artifacts are being uploaded to the S3 location.
Completed - The training job has completed.
Failed - The training job has failed. The reason for the failure is returned in the FailureReason field of DescribeTrainingJobResponse.
MaxRuntimeExceeded - The job stopped because it exceeded the maximum allowed runtime.
Stopped - The training job has stopped.
Stopping - Stopping the training job.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that shows when the training job transitioned to the current secondary status state.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that shows when the training job transitioned out of this secondary status state into another secondary status state or when the training job has ended.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A detailed description of the progress within a secondary status.
Starting the training job.
Launching requested ML instances.
Insufficient capacity error from EC2 while launching instances, retrying!
Launched instance was unhealthy, replacing it!
Preparing the instances for training.
Training image download completed. Training in progress.

nested_items.name: FinalMetricDataList
nested_items.description: A collection of MetricData objects that specify the names, values, and dates and times that the training algorithm emitted to Amazon CloudWatch.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the metric.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time that the algorithm emitted the metric.

nested_items.name: EnableNetworkIsolation
nested_items.description: If you want to allow inbound or outbound network calls, except for calls between peers within a training cluster for distributed training, choose True. If you enable network isolation for training jobs that are configured to use a VPC, SageMaker downloads and uploads customer data and model artifacts through the specified VPC, but the training container does not have network access.

nested_items.name: EnableInterContainerTrafficEncryption
nested_items.description: To encrypt all communications between ML compute instances in distributed training, choose True. Encryption provides greater security for distributed training, but training might take longer. How long it takes depends on the amount of communication between compute instances, especially if you use a deep learning algorithms in distributed training.

nested_items.name: EnableManagedSpotTraining
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether managed spot training is enabled ( True) or not ( False).

nested_items.name: CheckpointConfig
nested_items.description: Contains information about the output location for managed spot training checkpoint data.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want SageMaker to store checkpoints. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: (Optional) The local directory where checkpoints are written. The default directory is /opt/ml/checkpoints/.

nested_items.name: TrainingTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The training time in seconds.

nested_items.name: BillableTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The billable time in seconds. Billable time refers to the absolute wall-clock time.

nested_items.name: DebugHookConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration information for the Amazon SageMaker Debugger hook parameters, metric and tensor collections, and storage paths. To learn more about how to configure the DebugHookConfig parameter, see Use the SageMaker and Debugger Configuration API Operations to Create, Update, and Debug Your Training Job.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: Path to local storage location for metrics and tensors. Defaults to /opt/ml/output/tensors/.

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Path to Amazon S3 storage location for metrics and tensors.

nested_items.name: HookParameters
nested_items.description: Configuration information for the Amazon SageMaker Debugger hook parameters.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CollectionConfigurations
nested_items.description: Configuration information for Amazon SageMaker Debugger tensor collections. To learn more about how to configure the CollectionConfiguration parameter, see Use the SageMaker and Debugger Configuration API Operations to Create, Update, and Debug Your Training Job.

nested_items.name: CollectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the tensor collection. The name must be unique relative to other rule configuration names.

nested_items.name: CollectionParameters
nested_items.description: Parameter values for the tensor collection. The allowed parameters are "name", "include_regex", "reduction_config", "save_config", "tensor_names", and "save_histogram".
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ExperimentConfig
nested_items.description: Associates a SageMaker job as a trial component with an experiment and trial. Specified when you call the following APIs:
CreateProcessingJob.
CreateTrainingJob.
CreateTransformJob.

nested_items.name: DebugRuleConfigurations
nested_items.description: Configuration information for Amazon SageMaker Debugger rules for debugging output tensors.

nested_items.name: RuleConfigurationName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule configuration. It must be unique relative to other rule configuration names.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: Path to local storage location for output of rules. Defaults to /opt/ml/processing/output/rule/.

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Path to Amazon S3 storage location for rules.

nested_items.name: RuleEvaluatorImage
nested_items.description: The Amazon Elastic Container (ECR) Image for the managed rule evaluation.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type to deploy a custom rule for debugging a training job.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size, in GB, of the ML storage volume attached to the processing instance.

nested_items.name: RuleParameters
nested_items.description: Runtime configuration for rule container.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TensorBoardOutputConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration of storage locations for the Amazon SageMaker Debugger TensorBoard output data.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: Path to local storage location for tensorBoard output. Defaults to /opt/ml/output/tensorboard.

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Path to Amazon S3 storage location for TensorBoard output.

nested_items.name: DebugRuleEvaluationStatuses
nested_items.description: Evaluation status of Amazon SageMaker Debugger rules for debugging on a training job.

nested_items.name: RuleConfigurationName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule configuration.

nested_items.name: RuleEvaluationJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the rule evaluation job.

nested_items.name: RuleEvaluationStatus
nested_items.description: Status of the rule evaluation.

nested_items.name: StatusDetails
nested_items.description: Details from the rule evaluation.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: Timestamp when the rule evaluation status was last modified.

nested_items.name: ProfilerConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration information for Amazon SageMaker Debugger system monitoring, framework profiling, and storage paths.

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Path to Amazon S3 storage location for system and framework metrics.

nested_items.name: ProfilingIntervalInMilliseconds
nested_items.description: A time interval for capturing system metrics in milliseconds. Available values are 100, 200, 500, 1000 (1 second), 5000 (5 seconds), and 60000 (1 minute) milliseconds. The default value is 500 milliseconds.

nested_items.name: ProfilingParameters
nested_items.description: Configuration information for capturing framework metrics. Available key strings for different profiling options are DetailedProfilingConfig, PythonProfilingConfig, and DataLoaderProfilingConfig. The following codes are configuration structures for the ProfilingParameters parameter. To learn more about how to configure the ProfilingParameters parameter, see Use the SageMaker and Debugger Configuration API Operations to Create, Update, and Debug Your Training Job.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DisableProfiler
nested_items.description: Configuration to turn off Amazon SageMaker Debugger's system monitoring and profiling functionality. To turn it off, set to True.

nested_items.name: ProfilerRuleConfigurations
nested_items.description: Configuration information for Amazon SageMaker Debugger rules for profiling system and framework metrics.

nested_items.name: RuleConfigurationName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule configuration. It must be unique relative to other rule configuration names.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: Path to local storage location for output of rules. Defaults to /opt/ml/processing/output/rule/.

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Path to Amazon S3 storage location for rules.

nested_items.name: RuleEvaluatorImage
nested_items.description: The Amazon Elastic Container Registry Image for the managed rule evaluation.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type to deploy a custom rule for profiling a training job.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size, in GB, of the ML storage volume attached to the processing instance.

nested_items.name: RuleParameters
nested_items.description: Runtime configuration for rule container.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProfilerRuleEvaluationStatuses
nested_items.description: Evaluation status of Amazon SageMaker Debugger rules for profiling on a training job.

nested_items.name: RuleConfigurationName
nested_items.description: The name of the rule configuration.

nested_items.name: RuleEvaluationJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the rule evaluation job.

nested_items.name: RuleEvaluationStatus
nested_items.description: Status of the rule evaluation.

nested_items.name: StatusDetails
nested_items.description: Details from the rule evaluation.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: Timestamp when the rule evaluation status was last modified.

nested_items.name: ProfilingStatus
nested_items.description: Profiling status of a training job.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: The environment variables to set in the Docker container.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RetryStrategy
nested_items.description: The number of times to retry the job when the job fails due to an InternalServerError.

nested_items.name: MaximumRetryAttempts
nested_items.description: The number of times to retry the job. When the job is retried, it's SecondaryStatus is changed to STARTING.

nested_items.name: RemoteDebugConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration for remote debugging. To learn more about the remote debugging functionality of SageMaker, see Access a training container through Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) for remote debugging.

nested_items.name: EnableRemoteDebug
nested_items.description: If set to True, enables remote debugging.

nested_items.name: InfraCheckConfig
nested_items.description: Contains information about the infrastructure health check configuration for the training job.

nested_items.name: EnableInfraCheck
nested_items.description: Enables an infrastructure health check.
